options.content: No mass crosses system boundary while energy in the form of heat/work may transferred between closed system and its surrounding

content: Among the following one contains necessary chemical engineering information to operate a given factory.
Which one of the following processing condition may not affect the composition of top and bottom products
If the flowrate of the distillate recorded to be zero during operation, among the following one may not be the possible reason for this output
Let's say the air around us contains 20 ppm He (Helium). This means that

options.label: A
options.content: If one assumes that a molar basis is being used, for every moles of air there are 20 moles of Helium

options.label: B
options.content: If one assumes that a molar basis is being used, for every million moles of air there are 20 moles of Helium

options.label: C
options.content: If one assumes that a molar basis is being used, for every hundred moles of air there are 20 moles of Helium

content: What is the chemical reaction rate?

options.label: A
options.content: Chemical reaction rate is a chemical property

options.label: B
options.content: Chemical reaction rate is a physical property

options.label: C
options.content: Chemical reaction rate is an intensive property

options.label: D
options.content: Chemical reaction rate is an extensive property

content: Which of the following deals with the study of rates at which chemical reactions occur and the effect of various parameters on the rate?
Catalyst is a substance that ___________

options.label: A
options.content: Can either increase or decrease the speed of a chemical reaction

options.label: B
options.content: Alters the value of the equilibrium constant in a reversible chemical reaction

options.label: C
options.content: Increases the speed of a chemical reaction

options.label: D
options.content: Decreases the speed of a chemical reaction

content: Which of the following is true for fluidized catalytic beds?

options.label: B
options.content: They come under the category of batch reactors

options.label: C
options.content: The bulk density is a function of the flow rate through the bed

options.label: D
options.content: They cannot be used for multi-phase chemical reactions

content: Which of the following is the most suitable reactor for the pharmaceutical industry?
The rate constant of a first order reaction depends on the _____________
Which of the following is not a reversible reaction?

options.label: A
options.content: Oxidation of sulphur dioxide to sulphur trioxide

options.label: C
options.content: Formation of hydrogen bromide from its elements

content: The catalyst in a first-order chemical reaction changes the _______________

options.label: D
options.content: Heat of formation of the product

content: The rate of reaction is rapid for which of the following reactions?
Which of the following theories does not propose the temperature dependence of rate constant?
Which of the following is true for gas-phase reactions?

options.label: A
options.content: Decrease in moles of the product increases the volume of the reaction mixture

options.label: B
options.content: Increase in moles of the product does not affect the volume of the reaction mixture

options.label: C
options.content: Increase in moles of the product increases the volume of the reaction mixture

options.label: D
options.content: Increase in moles of the product decreases the volume of the reaction mixture

content: Which of the following is NOT a part of reactor design?

options.label: A
options.content: Flow rates of the reactant and product streams

content: Which of the following reactions follows elementary rate law?

options.label: A
options.content: Reversible catalytic decomposition of isopropyl benzene

content: Which of the following is true for the rate law of a reversible reaction?

options.label: A
options.content: Rate law can be written only in terms of concentrations

options.label: B
options.content: It reduces to irreversible form when product concentration is zero

options.label: C
options.content: It satisfies thermodynamic relationships at all times

options.label: D
options.content: Rate law can be written only in terms of partial pressures
